con:testCase.name: How to verify recorded resource path and URL params in a POST request
con:testCase.con:description:
Illustrates how to verify recorded resource paths and URL params in POST requests to a mock service. Note that resource paths need to be enabled for the service in mock configuration (ws-mock.properties)
Although example uses POST, this will work with other supported REST methods as well (GET, PUT, DELETE)

con:restRequest.name: Send POST request with resource path and some params to the service

con:testCase.name: How to verify that Mock Service received requests with xml declarations

con:testStep.name: Init the version of SayHello mock service that is not ignoring xml declarations (see ws-mock.properties)

con:restRequest.name: Init the version of SayHello mock service that is not ignoring xml declarations (see ws-mock.properties)

con:testStep.name: Send a SOAP message with xml declaration

con:restRequest.name: Send a SOAP message with xml declaration

con:testStep.name: Verify that xml declaration is found under recorded requests

con:restRequest.name: Verify that xml declaration is found under recorded requests

con:configuration.scriptText:
import com.eviware.soapui.support.XmlHolder
log.info messageExchange.responseContent
assert messageExchange.responseContent.contains("<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>") == true

con:testCase.name: How to verify that Mock Service received the right SOAP requests

con:testStep.name: Init the version of SayHello mock service that is not ignoring xml declarations (see ws-mock.properties)

con:testStep.name: Send a SOAP message with xml declaration

con:restRequest.name: Send a SOAP message with xml declaration

con:testStep.name: Verify that xml declaration is found under recorded requests

con:restRequest.name: Verify that xml declaration is found under recorded requests

con:configuration.scriptText:
import com.eviware.soapui.support.XmlHolder
log.info messageExchange.responseContent
assert messageExchange.responseContent.contains("<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>") == true
